Key Match Events: DJ Herz did not allow a hit until the fifth inning in the 5-3 loss at Nationals Park.
Herz delivered 4 2/3 innings on 87 pitches (55 strikes), with two walks and five strikeouts.
Herz opened the game by striking out Ian Happ with a 96.5 mph fastball.
Herz swiftly delivered another 11-pitch, 1-2-3 inning in the third.
Herz allowed his first hit of the game when Isaac Paredes singled on a slider into left field to open the fifth.
Herz issued a walk to Michael Busch and a single to Nico Hoerner to load the bases with no outs.
Herz surrendered a sacrifice fly to Pete Crow-Armstrong that put the Cubs on the board.
Herz was replaced by Jacob Barnes, and he was charged with the run when Christian Bethancourt scored on a Dansby Swanson double.
Post-Match Reflections: Herz expressed that facing his former team meant a lot to him and acknowledged the emotional significance.
Manager Dave Martinez commented on Herz's performance, noting that he threw the ball well overall but struggled in one inning.
Catcher Drew Millas praised Herz's pitching, mentioning that his changeup, spin, and heater were effective.
